page.title: 05Leisure Pursuits.Haxby Road
page.content: Children's leisure time activities. We surveyed the children in our class who live in the 12km block and found that most of the twenty have several hobbies and take part in some type of sport.Most of the children played in one of the school teams or for a cubscout football team.The most popular activities were watching T.V., reading,riding bicycles,computer games,jigsaw puzzles and roller skating.Only three out of twenty children did any knitting or sewing. One helped his father with the gardening.Four children made collections of various things and two were model makers.Twelve children joined in school clubs such as badminton,model railway or music. Eleven children went to a local club on their housing estate or to a church group. C.S.Hall.
